intro: Lotus rostellatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lotus, is a species of aquatic plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that float on the surface of freshwater bodies. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom above the water. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Lotus rostellatus plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
